data.title: Disney Channel Stars: Then and Now
data.meta_description: Your favorite childhood stars are all grown up.
data.text:
Rodrigo was on another Disney show before she was on High School Musical: The Musical: The Series. The actress played comedic songwriter Paige Olvera on the Disney series Bizaardvark from 2016 to 2019.

She was later cast as Nini on the Disney+ series about a high school putting on the Disney musical, High School Musical.

The Disney star has been making headlines ever since the release of her single “Driver’s License” in 2021. Fans speculate that the song points to a real-life love triangle between Rodrigo, her ex-boyfriend and HSMTMTS co-star Joshua Bassett and Girl Meets World star Sabrina Carpenter.

In 2021, Rodrigo further fanned the gossip flames with the release of her song "Deja Vu."

In 2020, Carpenter appeared in the Netflix movie Work It and the Disney movie Clouds.

In 2021, Carpenter was thought to be part of a love triangle between Disney stars Olivia Rodrigo and Joshua Bassett, after Rodrigo referenced an older, “blonde girl” in her song “Driver’s License.” Weeks later, Carpenter, who is also a singer and song-writer, released a single called “Skin” and fans speculated that it had something to do with the romantic situation.

Carpenter took to Instagram to share a message with her fans, and address feud rumors pitting herself against Rodrigo. "I wasn’t bothered by a few lines in a (magnificent) song and wrote a diss track about it," Carpenter shared. "I was at a tipping point in my life for countless reasons. So I was inspired to do what I usually do to cope, write something that I wish I could have told myself in the past."

Pettis got her first Disney role at the age of eight on the TV series Hannah Montana. In 2007, she played the daughter of Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson in the Disney comedy, The Game Plan. That same year, Pettis joined the cast of Cory in the House as bratty Sophie Martinez.

In 2011, Pettis starred on the sitcom Life with Boys. She later had a recurring role on the Disney XD series Lab Rats and on the Freeform series The Fosters.

The busy actress has never slowed down. From 2016 to 2019, she played the voice of Zuri on the animated series The Lion Guard and had a recurring role on the drama Five Points.

Her upcoming project He’s All That is an updated remake of the 1999 film She's All That.

The Georgia-born actress is best known among Disney fans for her character Chyna Parks on the network’s series A.N.T. Farm. The series aired from 2011 to 2014. A.N.T. Farm was not McClain's only Disney role.

The actress has been in many Disney projects, including: Jonas, Wizards of Waverly Place, How to Build a Better Boy and in Disney’s Descendants franchise.

The Indiana-born actor started his Disney career with various roles on Disney XD, including Zeke and Luther and Kirby Buckets. From there, he starred on A.N.T. Farm with co-stars Sierra McCormick and China Anne McClain. Short played Oliver on the Disney XD series Mighty Med from 2013 to 2015.

The actor also appeared on the Lab Rats spin-off show, Lab Rats: Elite Force, in 2016.

In 2020, Short starred in the British sports comedy The First Team. That same year, he played Mikey in the David Henrie directed film, This Is the Year.

His upcoming projects include a movie called Supercool, about a teen who makes a wish that comes true. It is set for a 2021 release.

Miley married actor Liam Hemsworth in 2018. The couple later divorced that same year. In 2020, Cyrus released her seventh studio album, Plastic Hearts.

In honor of the fifteenth anniversary of Hannah Montana, Cyrus penned a heartfelt letter to her alter ego. "You were like a rocket that flew me to the moon and never brought me back down," she wrote.

Since her time on the show, the star has recorded five studio albums and currently stars on TV Land’s Younger. In 2019, Duff married Matthew Koma. The couple have two children. Duff shares her son Luca, with ex-husband Mike Comrie.

In 2021, it was announced that the Lizzie McGuire actress will star in the How I Met Your Mother sequel series, How I Met Your Father.

The actor played mischievous Louis Stevens on Even Stevens from 2000 to 2003. The popular Disney Channel series even had its own TV movie, but that was only the beginning of LaBeouf's movie career.

The curly-haired actor went onto star in such blockbusters as Transformers and Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull.

La Beouf's movie career is still going strong. His recently movies include Honey Boy, The Peanut Butter Falcon and Pieces of a Woman. Unfortunately, the star has been plagued with substance abuse problems. In July 2017, he was arrested in Savannah, Georgia, for public drunkenness, obstruction and disorderly conduct.

The actor has also been the subject of abuse allegations by artist and ex-girlfriend FKA Twigs.

The twins had some TV and film success before their Disney careers. They both played Julian, the little boy who stole hearts in the Adam Sandler movie, Big Daddy. They also played Ross Geller's son, Ben, on the sitcom Friends. They began starring on The Suite Life of Zack and Cody in 2005.

They would continue playing Zack and Cody on the spin-off series, The Suite Life on Deck, in 2008.

Both boys graduated with honors from New York University's Gallatin School of Individualized Study in 2015. As a joke, they received each other’s diplomas during their graduation ceremony.

Cole currently stars as Jughead in the CW’s Riverdale. Dylan is back in front of the camera with the movie After We Collided.

Although her first TV role was on Barney & Friends, her first Disney role was on As the Bell Rings. The actress and singer was also the lead of Sonny With a Chance.

Lovato's Disney career was defined by her starring role alongside Joe Jonas in the DCOM, Camp Rock. She and Jonas were also the stars of Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam.

After a difficult few years that included suffering from bulimia, substance abuse and self-harm, the "Sorry Not Sorry" singer is now stronger than ever and has become an advocate for those suffering from the same issues, all while becoming a venerable pop star in her own right.

She recently released an intimate series on YouTube about her life, career, trauma, and struggles with addiction titled Demi Lovato: Dancing With the Devil.

After his Disney Channel stardom, the actor went on to become an even bigger movie star. Efron had starring roles in movies such as Neighbors, Baywatch and the movie musical The Greatest Showman. In 2019, Efron portrayed American serial killer Ted Bundy in the Netflix crime drama Extremely Wicked, Shockingly Evil and Vile.

In 2020, the celeb hosted the Netflix travel series Down to Earth with Zac Efron. Efron is anticipated to star in the Disney+ remake of Three Men and a Baby. The title is set for 2022 release.

The "It Ain't Me" singer has been focusing on her music career. In 2020, she released the album Rare, and launched her beauty line Rare Beauty by Selena Gomez. In 2021, she released a Spanish-language album, Revelación.

Gomez currently stars on the HBO Max cooking series, Selena + Chef. She will have a role in the 2021 TV show Only Murders in the Building.

You may remember her as Andrew Garfield's character's overbearing girlfriend in The Social Network or as ditzy hotel heiress London Tipton on Disney's The Suite Life of Zack and Cody, but this California-born actress has been on the small screen since 1994. She's had roles on some of your childhood favorites, including Small Talk, MADtv, 7th Heaven and The Bernie Mac Show.

Throughout her teen years, Song starred in many Disney original movies and TV series including Get a Clue, Stuck in the Suburbs, Phil of the Future, Wendy Wu: Homecoming Warrior and Yay Me! Starring London Tipton.

Song went on to have roles on Scandal, New Girl, Dads and Station 19. Although she was publicly upset about not getting to audition for Crazy Rich Asians, the former Disney darling is now a lead on the Hulu original series Dollface. In 2019, she was the star of the Netflix movie Secret Obsession.

The former child star has been candid about what it’s like to work with other former kid stars. "Child actors, we don't even get to talk about it, you just look each other in the eye and you nod and we know," the actress told ET at Disney Channel's fanfest at California Adventure Park in 2019.

In 2021, Song had her first child with boyfriend Macaulay Culkin.

Though she got started as a model, Zendaya got her big break as Rocky Blue on the Disney series Shake It Up. The actress also had roles on the Disney series A.N.T. Farm and the Disney sitcom K.C. Undercover.

Although she had always made music with Disney, Zendaya got to show off her vocal chops in the 2017 movie musical The Greatest Showman.

The Oakland-born actress had leading roles in Spider-Man: Homecoming and Spider-Man: Far from Home. She is currently the star of the HBO series Euphoria.

In 2021, she was one of the stars of the drama Malcolm & Marie. Her upcoming projects include Spider-Man: No Way Home and Space Jam: A New Legacy.

Vanessa is still taking the stage regularly, having starred as the title role in Gigi on Broadway and as Rizzo in Fox’s Grease: Live. In 2019, she played Maureen for TV's Rent: Live. She is also anticipated to appear in another Jonathan Larson musical, this time for Netflix's Lin-Manuel Miranda-directed 2021 feature, tick, tick...Boom!.

The actress, who is also the star of the Princess Switch holiday movies, is currently dating MLB player Cole Tucker.

Jake became one of many Disney kids to compete on Dancing With the Stars (Zendaya did too!), though his time on the competition show was short-lived -- he was the first to be eliminated with his partner Jenna Johnson in Season 23.

In 2020, the actor had a role in the crime drama Adverse. In 2021, he played Angel Ramirez on the series The Rise.

Before he was on Disney, Earles had roles on Malcolm in the Middle and Still Standing. He even had a part in the 2004 film National Treasure.

The actor rose to fame playing Miley Cyrus’ 16-year-old brother Jackson Stewart on the Disney series Hannah Montana -- despite the fact that he was 29 years old at the time!

Ryan was the star of many Disney Channel original movies, including Smart House, The Luck of the Irish and A Ring of Endless Light.

Before his Disney fame, the Oklahoma-born celeb appeared on many TV shows. Merriman was on The Mommies from 1993 to 1995. From 1996 to 2000, he had a role on the show The Pretender.

He has since continued to spend time on the small screen. The actor has had roles on Pretty Little Liars and appeared in movies such asThe Ring Two, Final Destination 3 and 42.

In 2021, he was in the film Diamond Rose. The actor's upcoming projects include Out of Exile and Model House.

Before Bieber or One Direction, there were the Jonas Brothers. When this band of brothers guest starred on Hannah Montana, they stole hearts across the world. The band toured with Miley Cyrus, and Nick even dated Miley for a bit in 2009.

After the boys starred in the DCOMs Camp Rock and Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam, they got their own Disney Channel show, Jonas.

Guess who got back together! The Jonas Brothers put out a new album in 2019 and even went on tour. Joe Jonas married actress Sophie Turner in May 2019. They welcomed a daughter, Willa, in 2020.

Nick Jonas married actress Priyanka Chopra in December 2018.

Kevin Jonas is still married to Danielle. The couple have two daughter.

The actress joined The Cosby Show in 1989 when she was just four years old, then had roles on Hangin' with Mr. Cooper, My Wife and Kids and in the 1998 movie Doctor Dolittle. She became widely known for her performance as Raven on Disney Channel's series about a teen psychic called That's So Raven, and for her work in The Cheetah Girls films.

The actress’ early career is largely defined by her Disney work, which includes many titles such as Zenon: Girl of the 21st Century, The Proud Family, Zenon: Z3, The Princess Diaries 2: Royal Engagement, Kim Possible, and the That’s So Raven spinoff series Cory in the House.

Life has become busy for the That's So Raven star. She has most recently been a host on The View, a contestant on The Masked Singer, guest-starred on Black-ish and is now starring on the That's So Raven reboot, Raven's Home. The actress also got married in 2020.

Also in 2020, the former child star hinted that she might be “helping out” on Cheetah Girl pal Adrienne Houghton’s talk show series, The Real. “I'll never say no to a cool job," she told ET. "I don't mind helping out where they need me to. As long as we're corona safe, I'm down for the cause."

Although he was best known for his role as Rico in Hannah Montana, Arias had small roles in other Disney Channel shows. The pint-sized child star appeared on The Suite Life of Zack & Cody and Wizards of Waverly Place.

He also voiced the character Fred on Phineas and Ferb.

The Disney Channel alum has still got the acting bug. His film, The Kings of Summer, premiered at the 2013 Sundance Film Festival. In 2020, he had a major role in the Judd Apatow movie The King of Staten Island.

His upcoming projects include titles such as Samaritan and American Murderer.

Before he played Beans, the annoying neighbor on Even Stevens, Lawrence had a bevy of TV roles. His instantly recognizable face was seen on Sabrina the Teenage Witch, ER, Buffy the Vampire Slayer and Frasier.

The Disney actor also had a role on the Disney series That's So Raven.

After the Disney series that made him a celeb, Lawrence appeared in the films The Cat in the Hat, Cheaper by the Dozen, Kicking & Screaming and Bratz. Since then, the actor has had a smattering of roles including on Weeds and Eagleheart.

In 2015, the news that the actor was working as a Santa’s helper at a mall in Concord, California, went viral. Lawrence appeared in the 2020 film, I Wrote This for You.
